title: Call Metadata Standard
description: Meta data supporting dialtone, ringdown, and shoutdown calls

state.description: Name of the latest state of the current communication, for example: CallOriginated, CallDelivered, CallEstablished

time.description: Date and time when the state changed for the given participant

audioInterface.description: The interface on the device used to handle the communication - it could change during the lifetime of the communication, for example:  ‘left handset’, ‘right handset’, ‘microphone’,‘speaker’”

sUserID.description: The userID from within the system capturing the record

pUserID.description: The userID from within the underlying platform used for the communication

groupName.description: Name of the group for which the participant is representing in the communication

firmName.description: Name of the participant's firm represented in the communication

timeZoneOffset.description: The UTC timezone offset for the participant

participant.description: Specific details about a participant of the call

address.description: The address of the participant. It can be a URL, a username or any other type of address used to reach this participant.

involvement.description: How the participant joined the communication. Did they initiate it(source), receieve a request(destination) or join an ongoing communication(participant)?

startTime.description: Date and time when the participant was requested to participate on the call

joinTime.description: Date and time when the participant joined the call

exitTime.description: Date and time when the participant exited the call

comFile.description: Information about the file associated with the communication record

recordID.description: The id of the file as stored

fileName.description: The name of the file as stored

archiveDate.description: The date the file should be removed date-time format

quality.description: Any data providing quality stats on the file.  For example for Voice Recording or Transcription details may be provided defining the suggested qulaity of the file.

checksum.description: Checksum of the file used to verify the file integrity. The hash values are compared and, if they match, confirms that the data has not been altered. It can be stored in one of the supported algorithms listed in type enum

type.description: Hash algorithm used on file checksum.

hash.description: Checksum of the file in the selected hash type

system.description: The system capturing the communication record

UID.description: Unique Identifier of the system capturing the communication record

systemType.description: The type of communication system which is populating the data in this JSON (VoicePlatform - a PaBX or other voice platform, Mobile - a mobile carrier)

name.description: Name of the system providing the communication record

deviceInfo.description: Identifying the perspective of the device the system is capturing the communication record about

deviceID.description: Identifier for the device used for the communication

audioInterface.description: The interface on the device used to handle the communication, for example:  ‘left handset’, ‘right handset’, ‘microphone’,‘speaker’”

buttonName.description: The name on the consuming app for the connection

channelID.description: Identifier for the resource (channel, extension, etc)

participants.description: List of participant objects describing the other parts on the call

comType.description: The type of communication which is populated in this JSON (could be the type of telephony or another communication type. )

comUUID.description: Universally Unique Identifier for this communication for a given participant. Will be unique across all call records.

startTime.description: The time when the communication started

endTime.description: The time when the communication terminated

universalID.description: A ID the underlying platform may provide to link multiple calls within the system. For example where multiple calls are in conference some systems may link them with a universal call id.

csID.description: The ID generated by the platform managing the communication for the target user.

activeDuration.description: The duration the participant was actively engaged in the communication (for example removing hold states), in milliseconds

state.description: The state of the communication when the record was generated

name.description: The actual platform used for example telephony platforms could be could be Cisco, Avaya, BT ITS, IPC, Ect

id.description: The location / ID of the platform to uniquely identify it.
